shlomo-barak.bio: Israeli CEO who led Orbotech through its acquisition by KLA.

doron-myersdorf.name: Doron Myersdorf
doron-myersdorf.bio: Israeli founder and CEO of StoreDot.

omer-keilaf.name: Omer Keilaf
omer-keilaf.bio: Israeli co-founder and CEO of Innoviz Technologies.

daniel-barel.name: Daniel Barel
daniel-barel.bio: Israeli co-founder and CEO of REE Automotive.

gavriel-iddan.name: Gavriel Iddan
gavriel-iddan.bio: Israeli engineer who invented the PillCam capsule endoscopy.

idan-ofer.name: Idan Ofer
idan-ofer.bio: Israeli billionaire, controlling shareholder of ICL through Israel Corp.

edmond-de-rothschild.name: Edmond de Rothschild
edmond-de-rothschild.bio: Jewish French banker who funded early Jewish settlements and wineries in Palestine.

eliezer-manor.name: Eliezer Manor
eliezer-manor.bio: Israeli businessman who led Ahava's global expansion.

avi-nir.name: Avi Nir
avi-nir.bio: Israeli CEO of Keshet Media Group.

amos-regev.name: Amos Regev
amos-regev.bio: Israeli journalist and CEO of Channel 13.

matthew-freud.name: Matthew Freud
matthew-freud.bio: British PR executive, great-grandson of Sigmund Freud.

maurice-saatchi.name: Maurice Saatchi
maurice-saatchi.bio: Iraqi-Jewish co-founder of Saatchi & Saatchi. Now Baron Saatchi.

martin-sorrell.name: Martin Sorrell
martin-sorrell.bio: Jewish British businessman who founded and built WPP into the world's largest ad company.

israel-sieff.name: Israel Sieff
israel-sieff.bio: Jewish businessman and Zionist who led M&S for decades.

maurice-l-vy.name: Maurice Lévy
maurice-l-vy.bio: Jewish chairman, led Publicis for decades.

marcel-dassault.name: Marcel Dassault
marcel-dassault.bio: Born Marcel Bloch, Jewish French aviation pioneer and industrialist.

serge-dassault.name: Serge Dassault
serge-dassault.bio: Son of Marcel, ran the Dassault empire.

hubert-sagni-res.name: Hubert Sagnières
hubert-sagni-res.bio: Former CEO of Essilor who expanded Israeli partnerships.

gunter-demnig.name: Gunter Demnig
gunter-demnig.bio: German artist who created the Stolpersteine project.

peter-munk.name: Peter Munk
peter-munk.bio: Hungarian-born Canadian Jewish mining magnate, founder of Barrick Gold.

anthony-pratt.name: Anthony Pratt
anthony-pratt.bio: Jewish Australian billionaire, chairman of Visy Industries and Pratt Industries.

harry-oppenheimer.name: Harry Oppenheimer
harry-oppenheimer.bio: Jewish South African, son of Ernest, led Anglo American and De Beers.

vicky-safra.name: Vicky Safra
vicky-safra.bio: Jewish widow of Joseph Safra, one of the world's richest women.

arkady-volozh.name: Arkady Volozh
arkady-volozh.bio: Kazakh-born Jewish co-founder of Yandex. Now based in Israel.

david-sassoon.name: David Sassoon
david-sassoon.bio: Baghdadi Jewish businessman who established a vast trade empire in India.

rabbi-nachman-of-breslov.name: Rabbi Nachman of Breslov
rabbi-nachman-of-breslov.bio: Hasidic master buried in Uman, Ukraine.

chiune-sugihara.name: Chiune Sugihara
chiune-sugihara.bio: Japanese diplomat who issued visas saving thousands of Jews.

houda-nonoo.name: Houda Nonoo
houda-nonoo.bio: Jewish Bahraini woman who served as Bahrain's ambassador to the US.

raoul-wallenberg.name: Raoul Wallenberg
raoul-wallenberg.bio: Swedish diplomat who saved tens of thousands of Hungarian Jews.

daniel-libeskind.name: Daniel Libeskind
daniel-libeskind.bio: Jewish-Polish-American architect who designed the museum.

sigmund-freud.name: Sigmund Freud
sigmund-freud.bio: Austrian Jewish neurologist who founded psychoanalysis.

donniel-hartman.name: Donniel Hartman
donniel-hartman.bio: Jewish philosopher and president of the Hartman Institute.

david-ellison.name: David Ellison
david-ellison.bio: David Ellison (Jewish), son of Oracle founder Larry Ellison, founded Skydance Media. Paramount agreed to merge with Skydance in 2024.

steven-mnuchin.name: Steven Mnuchin
steven-mnuchin.bio: Steven Mnuchin (Jewish) was a Goldman Sachs partner before serving as US Treasury Secretary 2017-2021.

max-lousada.name: Max Lousada
max-lousada.bio: Leads Warner Music's global recorded music operations.

andrew-viterbi.name: Andrew Viterbi
andrew-viterbi.bio: Andrew Viterbi (Jewish, Italian-born), co-founder of Qualcomm. Invented the Viterbi algorithm used in cellular networks, WiFi, and space communications. The Viterbi School of Engineering at USC bears his name.

ilya-sutskever.name: Ilya Sutskever
ilya-sutskever.bio: Ilya Sutskever (Jewish), born in Russia, raised in Israel. Co-founded OpenAI and was chief scientist. Pioneer of deep learning, student of Geoffrey Hinton. Left OpenAI in 2024 to found Safe Superintelligence Inc.

jacob-blaustein.name: Jacob Blaustein
jacob-blaustein.bio: Industrialist and philanthropist who served as AJC president (1949-1954). Negotiated the historic Blaustein-Ben-Gurion Agreement defining US Jewish-Israel relations.

abraham-foxman.name: Abraham Foxman
abraham-foxman.bio: National Director of the ADL from 1987 to 2015. Holocaust survivor born in Poland, saved by his Catholic nanny during WWII.

amy-spitalnick.name: Amy Spitalnick
amy-spitalnick.bio: CEO of JCPA. Previously served as executive director of Integrity First for America, which won a landmark case against white supremacist organizers of the Charlottesville rally.

marvin-hier.name: Marvin Hier
marvin-hier.bio: Founder and Dean of the Simon Wiesenthal Center since 1977. Rabbi Hier built the organization into a global force for Holocaust remembrance and tolerance education.

rabbi-noah-farkas.name: Rabbi Noah Farkas
rabbi-noah-farkas.bio: President and CEO of the Jewish Federation of Greater Los Angeles since 2021. Previously served as senior rabbi of Valley Beth Shalom.

lonnie-nasatir.name: Lonnie Nasatir
lonnie-nasatir.bio: President of the Jewish United Fund and Jewish Federation of Metropolitan Chicago. Previously led Jewish community organizations in Detroit.

daniel-s-mariaschin.name: Daniel S. Mariaschin
daniel-s-mariaschin.bio: CEO of B'nai B'rith International. Has led the organization's international advocacy, including engagement at the UN and with world leaders.

solomon-schechter.name: Solomon Schechter
solomon-schechter.bio: Romanian-born rabbi and scholar who founded the United Synagogue in 1913 and led JTS. Discovered the Cairo Genizah, one of the greatest manuscript finds in history.

rick-jacobs.name: Rick Jacobs
rick-jacobs.bio: President of the URJ since 2012. Previously senior rabbi of Westchester Reform Temple. Leads the largest Jewish denominational organization in North America.

joseph-soloveitchik.name: Joseph Soloveitchik
joseph-soloveitchik.bio: Known as 'The Rav,' Rabbi Soloveitchik (1903-1993) was the towering intellectual figure of Modern Orthodoxy and trained thousands of RCA rabbis at Yeshiva University.

sally-priesand.name: Sally Priesand
sally-priesand.bio: First woman ordained as a rabbi in America (1972, HUC-JIR). Pioneer who opened the rabbinate to women across all Jewish denominations.

henrietta-szold.name: Henrietta Szold
henrietta-szold.bio: Founded Hadassah in 1912 and directed Youth Aliyah, rescuing thousands of Jewish children from Nazi Europe. Considered one of the most important women in Jewish and Zionist history.

abraham-cahan.name: Abraham Cahan
abraham-cahan.bio: Editor of the Jewish Daily Forward for nearly 50 years (1903-1951). Lithuanian-born immigrant who made the Forward the most important Yiddish newspaper in America, shaping immigrant Jewish culture.

jacob-landau.name: Jacob Landau
jacob-landau.bio: Founded JTA in 1917, creating the first global Jewish news service. Modeled it on the Associated Press to provide reliable Jewish news worldwide.

norman-podhoretz.name: Norman Podhoretz
norman-podhoretz.bio: Editor of Commentary from 1960-1995. His ideological journey from liberalism to neoconservatism mirrored and influenced a generation of Jewish intellectuals. Author of 'Making It' and 'Breaking Ranks.'

elie-wiesel.name: Elie Wiesel
elie-wiesel.bio: Holocaust survivor, Nobel Peace Prize laureate (1986), author of 'Night,' and co-founder of Moment Magazine. Called the 'messenger to mankind' by the Nobel Committee.

max-weinreich.name: Max Weinreich
max-weinreich.bio: Co-founder of YIVO (1925) and pioneering Yiddish linguist. Author of 'History of the Yiddish Language.' Coined the phrase 'a language is a dialect with an army and a navy.'

haskel-lookstein.name: Haskel Lookstein
haskel-lookstein.bio: Senior rabbi of Kehilath Jeshurun for decades. Led the Modern Orthodox movement in NYC. Converted Ivanka Trump to Judaism. Principal of the Ramaz School.

yuli-edelstein.name: Yuli Edelstein
yuli-edelstein.bio: Former Speaker of the Knesset (2013-2020). Born in Ukraine, was a Prisoner of Zion in the Soviet Union before making aliyah. Represented Likud.

meir-dagan.name: Meir Dagan
meir-dagan.bio: Director of the Mossad (2002-2011). Widely credited with reinvigorating Mossad's operational capabilities. Oversaw operations including efforts to sabotage Iran's nuclear program.

sir-mick-davis.name: Sir Mick Davis
sir-mick-davis.bio: Sir Mick Davis, South African-born British businessman (Jewish), former CEO of Xstrata mining, served as chairman of the Jewish Leadership Council and CEO of the UK Conservative Party.

sir-hermann-gollancz.name: Sir Hermann Gollancz
sir-hermann-gollancz.bio: Sir Hermann Gollancz (Jewish), rabbi and scholar, was a prominent leader in the United Synagogue movement in the early 20th century.

michael-goldstein.name: Michael Goldstein
michael-goldstein.bio: Michael Goldstein served as president of the United Synagogue, overseeing modernization efforts.

clive-lawton.name: Clive Lawton
clive-lawton.bio: Clive Lawton OBE (Jewish), educator and communal leader, was a co-founder of Limmud in 1980 and helped establish it as an international Jewish learning movement.

lord-levy.name: Lord Levy
lord-levy.bio: Lord Michael Levy (Jewish), Labour Party fundraiser and life peer, has served as president of Jewish Care and is one of its principal supporters.

sir-moses-montefiore.name: Sir Moses Montefiore
sir-moses-montefiore.bio: Sir Moses Montefiore (Jewish, 1784-1885), British financier, philanthropist, and Sheriff of London, was a pioneering figure in Jewish humanitarian relief efforts from Britain.

leopold-greenberg.name: Leopold Greenberg
leopold-greenberg.bio: Leopold Greenberg (Jewish, 1861-1931), editor of the Jewish Chronicle for 26 years, was a key Zionist leader and confidant of Theodor Herzl.

justin-cohen.name: Justin Cohen
justin-cohen.bio: Justin Cohen (Jewish), journalist and editor, has served as a senior editorial figure at the Jewish News, shaping its coverage of Anglo-Jewish affairs.

jonathan-boyd.name: Jonathan Boyd
jonathan-boyd.bio: Jonathan Boyd (Jewish), executive director of JPR, leads the institute's research programs on European Jewish demographics, identity, and antisemitism.

rabbi-leo-baeck.name: Rabbi Leo Baeck
rabbi-leo-baeck.bio: Rabbi Leo Baeck (Jewish, 1873-1956), German rabbi, theologian, and leader of Progressive Judaism, led the Reich Association of German Jews under Nazi rule and survived Theresienstadt concentration camp.

moses-angel.name: Moses Angel
moses-angel.bio: Moses Angel (Jewish, 1819-1898), headmaster of Jews' Free School for 50 years (1842-1897), transformed it into one of the largest schools in England with over 4,000 pupils.

alfred-wiener.name: Alfred Wiener
alfred-wiener.bio: Dr. Alfred Wiener (Jewish, 1885-1964), German-born librarian and activist, founded the Wiener Library in Amsterdam in 1933 to document Nazi antisemitism. The collection was moved to London in 1939 and used as evidence at Nuremberg.

sir-trevor-pears.name: Sir Trevor Pears
sir-trevor-pears.bio: Sir Trevor Pears CMG (Jewish), executive chair of the Pears Foundation and director of the William Pears Group property business, is one of the UK's leading Jewish philanthropists.

avi-shaked.name: Avi Shaked
avi-shaked.bio: Avi Shaked (Jewish, Israeli), co-founder of 888 Holdings, helped build one of the world's largest online gambling platforms from its origins in Israel.

sir-nicholas-winton.name: Sir Nicholas Winton
sir-nicholas-winton.bio: Sir Nicholas Winton (1909-2015), British humanitarian, organized the rescue of 669 mostly Jewish children from Nazi-occupied Czechoslovakia via the Kindertransport. His efforts were unknown until 1988.

francis-kalifat.name: Francis Kalifat
francis-kalifat.bio: Francis Kalifat (Jewish, French), served as president of CRIF, leading its advocacy against antisemitism and efforts to strengthen France-Israel relations.

grand-rabbi-ha-m-korsia.name: Grand Rabbi Haïm Korsia
grand-rabbi-ha-m-korsia.bio: Grand Rabbi Haïm Korsia (Jewish, born 1963), Chief Rabbi of France since 2014, represents French Jewry in interfaith and public affairs. Previously served as chaplain general of the French armed forces.

adolphe-cr-mieux.name: Adolphe Crémieux
adolphe-cr-mieux.bio: Adolphe Crémieux (Jewish, 1796-1880), French lawyer and statesman, co-founded the Alliance Israélite Universelle in 1860 and authored the Crémieux Decree granting French citizenship to Algerian Jews.

emmanuel-levinas.name: Emmanuel Levinas
emmanuel-levinas.bio: Emmanuel Levinas (Jewish, 1906-1995), Lithuanian-born French philosopher, was one of the most influential thinkers of the 20th century. His work on ethics, alterity, and the Talmud transformed Continental philosophy.

shimon-koffler-fogel.name: Shimon Koffler Fogel
shimon-koffler-fogel.bio: Shimon Koffler Fogel (Jewish), CEO of CIJA, has led the organization's advocacy efforts on behalf of the Canadian Jewish community, engaging with government and media.

avi-benlolo.name: Avi Benlolo
avi-benlolo.bio: Avi Benlolo (Jewish), founding president and CEO of Friends of Simon Wiesenthal Center for Holocaust Studies in Canada, led its growth into a major Holocaust education organization.

samuel-bronfman.name: Samuel Bronfman
samuel-bronfman.bio: Samuel Bronfman (Jewish, 1889-1971), founder of Seagram, served as president of the Canadian Jewish Congress for decades, using his wealth and influence to advance Jewish communal interests in Canada.

alex-ryvchin.name: Alex Ryvchin
alex-ryvchin.bio: Alex Ryvchin (Jewish), co-CEO of the ECAJ, is a prominent advocate for the Australian Jewish community and author of books on antisemitism and Zionism.

colin-rubenstein.name: Colin Rubenstein
colin-rubenstein.bio: Dr. Colin Rubenstein AM (Jewish), executive director of AIJAC, has led the organization for decades and is one of Australia's most prominent advocates for Israel and the Jewish community.

peter-eisenman.name: Peter Eisenman
peter-eisenman.bio: Peter Eisenman (Jewish, born 1932), American architect and theorist, designed Berlin's Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe. Known for his deconstructivist approach and intellectually challenging architectural designs.

yuri-kanner.name: Yuri Kanner
yuri-kanner.bio: Yuri Kanner (Jewish, Russian), president of the Russian Jewish Congress, leads efforts to promote Jewish cultural life, fight antisemitism, and strengthen Jewish identity in Russia.

wendy-kahn.name: Wendy Kahn
wendy-kahn.bio: Wendy Kahn (Jewish), national director of the SAJBD, leads the organization's advocacy, community relations, and anti-antisemitism efforts in South Africa.

bernard-gillian-memory-gilligan.name: Bernard Gillian Memory Gilligan
bernard-gillian-memory-gilligan.bio: Jewish South African entrepreneurs founded Investec in 1974, which grew into a major international banking group.

rabbi-gavriel-holtzberg.name: Rabbi Gavriel Holtzberg
rabbi-gavriel-holtzberg.bio: Rabbi Gavriel Holtzberg (Jewish, Israeli, 1979-2008) and his wife Rivka ran Chabad Nariman House in Mumbai. Both were murdered during the 2008 Mumbai terrorist attacks.

alberto-nisman.name: Alberto Nisman
alberto-nisman.bio: Alberto Nisman (Jewish, 1963-2015), Argentine prosecutor, investigated the AMIA bombing for 10 years. Found dead with a gunshot wound in 2015, hours before he was to present evidence that President Cristina Kirchner covered up Iranian involvement.

rabbi-marshall-t-meyer.name: Rabbi Marshall T. Meyer
rabbi-marshall-t-meyer.bio: Rabbi Marshall T. Meyer (Jewish, American, 1930-1993), founder of the Seminario Rabínico Latinoamericano, heroically defended human rights during Argentina's military dictatorship (1976-1983), visiting political prisoners and documenting abuses.

xavier-l-pez-ancona.name: Xavier López Ancona
xavier-l-pez-ancona.bio: Xavier López Ancona (Jewish, Mexican), founder and chairman of KidZania, created one of the most innovative children's entertainment concepts, expanding from Mexico City to 25+ locations worldwide.

oskar-deutsch.name: Oskar Deutsch
oskar-deutsch.bio: Oskar Deutsch (Jewish), president of the IKG Wien, leads the Vienna Jewish community and advocates for Jewish interests in Austrian public life.

anne-frank.name: Anne Frank
anne-frank.bio: Anne Frank (Jewish, 1929-1945), born in Frankfurt, fled with her family to Amsterdam. Hid for two years and wrote her famous diary before being discovered. Died in Bergen-Belsen. Her diary became one of the most-read books in history.

klara-ko-odziejska-deg-rska.name: Klara Kołodziejska-Degórska
klara-ko-odziejska-deg-rska.bio: Chief Rabbi of Poland (Progressive), one of the first female rabbis in Polish history.

barbara-kirshenblatt-gimblett.name: Barbara Kirshenblatt-Gimblett
barbara-kirshenblatt-gimblett.bio: Professor at NYU who designed POLIN Museum's core exhibition on 1,000 years of Polish Jewish history.

piotr-cywi-ski.name: Piotr Cywiński
piotr-cywi-ski.bio: Director of the Auschwitz-Birkenau Memorial and Museum since 2006. Oversees preservation and education programs.

jonathan-ornstein.name: Jonathan Ornstein
jonathan-ornstein.bio: American-born executive director of the JCC Kraków since 2008, credited with revitalizing Jewish life in the city.

petr-papou-ek.name: Petr Papoušek
petr-papou-ek.bio: President of the Federation of Jewish Communities in the Czech Republic, leading community development and interfaith dialogue.

gennadiy-bogolubov.name: Gennadiy Bogolubov
gennadiy-bogolubov.bio: Ukrainian-Jewish billionaire, co-owner of PrivatBank, who funded the construction of the Menorah Center in Dnipro.

isak-haleva.name: Isak Haleva
isak-haleva.bio: Chief Rabbi (Hakham Bashi) of Turkey since 2002, leading the Sephardic Jewish community.

andr-azoulay.name: André Azoulay
andr-azoulay.bio: Jewish Moroccan businessman and senior adviser to King Mohammed VI and his father Hassan II, promoting interfaith dialogue and Moroccan-Israeli relations.

ross-kriel.name: Ross Kriel
ross-kriel.bio: South African-born businessman who has led the development of organized Jewish community life in the UAE.

david-marshall.name: David Marshall
david-marshall.bio: Singapore's first Chief Minister (1955-1956), Jewish politician of Baghdadi-Iraqi origin. Champion of Singapore's independence movement.

marc-baker.name: Marc Baker
marc-baker.bio: President and CEO of Combined Jewish Philanthropies, one of the largest Jewish federations in North America.

jacob-blumenthal.name: Jacob Blumenthal
jacob-blumenthal.bio: CEO of the Rabbinical Assembly, the international association of Conservative/Masorti rabbis.

andrew-rehfeld.name: Andrew Rehfeld
andrew-rehfeld.bio: President of Hebrew Union College-Jewish Institute of Religion, the seminary for Reform Judaism.

isaac-mayer-wise.name: Isaac Mayer Wise
isaac-mayer-wise.bio: Founder of Hebrew Union College (1875), the Union of American Hebrew Congregations, and the Central Conference of American Rabbis. Father of American Reform Judaism.

howard-hyman.name: Howard Hyman
howard-hyman.bio: National director of ORT America, the US affiliate of World ORT's global education network.

jack-h-skirball.name: Jack H. Skirball
jack-h-skirball.bio: Rabbi, film producer, and philanthropist who funded the Skirball Cultural Center in Los Angeles.

ivy-barsky.name: Ivy Barsky
ivy-barsky.bio: Former CEO and Gwen Goodman Director of the National Museum of American Jewish History in Philadelphia.

claudia-gould.name: Claudia Gould
claudia-gould.bio: Helen Goldsmith Menschel Director of The Jewish Museum, overseeing its renowned collection of Jewish art and culture.

bernard-michael.name: Bernard Michael
bernard-michael.bio: President of the Center for Jewish History, which houses five major Jewish historical organizations in NYC.

warren-buffett.name: Warren Buffett
warren-buffett.bio: Chairman and CEO of Berkshire Hathaway. While not Jewish himself, Buffett has deep ties to Jewish business figures and is a major supporter of Israel.

ajit-jain.name: Ajit Jain
ajit-jain.bio: Vice Chairman of Insurance Operations at Berkshire Hathaway. One of Berkshire's key leaders.

dennis-charney.name: Dennis Charney
dennis-charney.bio: Dean of Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai (Jewish), leading neuroscientist and researcher.

kenneth-davis.name: Kenneth Davis
kenneth-davis.bio: CEO of Mount Sinai Health System, building it into one of America's largest academic medical systems.

thomas-priselac.name: Thomas Priselac
thomas-priselac.bio: President and CEO of Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, one of the largest non-profit hospitals in the Western US.

gordon-bhatt.name: Gordon Bhatt
gordon-bhatt.bio: Dean of Albert Einstein College of Medicine, named after Albert Einstein.

brad-karp.name: Brad Karp
brad-karp.bio: Chairman of Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison (Jewish), one of the most prominent corporate lawyers in America.

david-greenwald.name: David Greenwald
david-greenwald.bio: Chairman of Fried Frank (Jewish), a major international law firm founded by Jewish lawyers.

richard-rosenbaum.name: Richard Rosenbaum
richard-rosenbaum.bio: Executive Chairman of Greenberg Traurig (Jewish), one of the world's largest law firms with 2,700+ attorneys.

joseph-m-proskauer.name: Joseph M. Proskauer
joseph-m-proskauer.bio: Co-founder of Proskauer Rose (Jewish), served as president of the American Jewish Committee from 1943-1949.

alan-waldenberg.name: Alan Waldenberg
alan-waldenberg.bio: Managing partner of Schulte Roth & Zabel (Jewish), a leading law firm specializing in investment management.

charles-kaye.name: Charles Kaye
charles-kaye.bio: Co-CEO of Warburg Pincus (Jewish), one of the largest global growth equity firms.

eric-warburg.name: Eric Warburg
eric-warburg.bio: German-American banker (Jewish) whose family's name is on the firm. The Warburgs were one of Europe's most prominent banking dynasties.

joshua-bekenstein.name: Joshua Bekenstein
joshua-bekenstein.bio: Co-Chairman of Bain Capital (Jewish), a leading global private investment firm managing over $175 billion.

ray-dalio.name: Ray Dalio
ray-dalio.bio: Founder of Bridgewater Associates, the world's largest hedge fund. While not Jewish, Bridgewater has significant Jewish connections in finance.

david-blitzer.name: David Blitzer
david-blitzer.bio: Co-owner of the 76ers (Jewish), Blackstone executive, and owner of multiple sports teams globally.

richard-haass.name: Richard Haass
richard-haass.bio: President of CFR (2003-2023) (Jewish), prominent foreign policy advisor and author.

robert-doar.name: Robert Doar
robert-doar.bio: President of AEI, a major conservative think tank influential in US policy.

john-walters.name: John Walters
john-walters.bio: President of Hudson Institute, a conservative think tank on national security and foreign policy.

michael-makovsky.name: Michael Makovsky
michael-makovsky.bio: President and CEO of JINSA (Jewish), advocating for a strong US-Israel strategic alliance.

eric-yuan.name: Eric Yuan
eric-yuan.bio: Founder and CEO of Zoom. While Yuan is not Jewish, the company has significant connections to Israeli tech talent.

patrick-collison.name: Patrick Collison
patrick-collison.bio: Co-founder and CEO of Stripe. While the Collison brothers are Irish, Stripe's payments infrastructure connects to major Jewish-led businesses.

samuel-irving-newhouse-jr.name: Samuel Irving Newhouse Jr.
samuel-irving-newhouse-jr.bio: Former chairman of Condé Nast (Jewish), overseeing Vogue, The New Yorker, Vanity Fair, and GQ. Newhouse family built one of America's largest media empires.

fred-ryan.name: Fred Ryan
fred-ryan.bio: Former publisher of The Washington Post. The paper was owned by the Meyer-Graham family (Jewish) for 80 years before Amazon's Jeff Bezos purchased it.

katharine-graham.name: Katharine Graham
katharine-graham.bio: Legendary publisher of The Washington Post (Jewish), oversaw publication of the Pentagon Papers and Watergate coverage. First female Fortune 500 CEO.

jim-joseph.name: Jim Joseph
jim-joseph.bio: Jewish-American businessman and philanthropist whose $500+ million estate created one of the largest foundations focused on Jewish education.

meir-soloveichik.name: Meir Soloveichik
meir-soloveichik.bio: Rabbi and scholar associated with the Maimonides Fund's mission of Jewish education and scholarship.

roger-hertog.name: Roger Hertog
roger-hertog.bio: Co-founder of the Tikva Fund (Jewish), supporting Jewish and Zionist intellectual life and education.

steven-a-fox.name: Steven A. Fox
steven-a-fox.bio: National director of Friends of the IDF, raising hundreds of millions for IDF soldier welfare.

scott-feltman.name: Scott Feltman
scott-feltman.bio: Director of One Israel Fund, supporting communities in Judea and Samaria.

andr-s-spokoiny.name: Andrés Spokoiny
andr-s-spokoiny.bio: President and CEO of Jewish Funders Network (Argentinian-born), convening Jewish philanthropists globally.

catherine-reed.name: Catherine Reed
catherine-reed.bio: CEO of American Friends of Magen David Adom, supporting Israel's national emergency medical service.

st-phane-bancel.name: Stéphane Bancel
st-phane-bancel.bio: CEO of Moderna, which developed one of the first COVID-19 mRNA vaccines. While Bancel is French, Moderna's chief medical officer Tal Zaks (Jewish, Israeli) played a key role.

michael-pearson.name: Michael Pearson
michael-pearson.bio: Former CEO who transformed Valeant through aggressive acquisition. The company later rebranded to Bausch Health.

uday-baldota.name: Uday Baldota
uday-baldota.bio: CEO of Taro Pharmaceutical Industries, an Israeli-founded pharmaceutical company now a subsidiary of Sun Pharma.

kenneth-gibbs.name: Kenneth Gibbs
kenneth-gibbs.bio: President and CEO of Maimonides Medical Center in Brooklyn, named after the medieval Jewish philosopher Moses Maimonides.

philip-ozuah.name: Philip Ozuah
philip-ozuah.bio: President and CEO of Montefiore Medicine, named after Sir Moses Montefiore, the Jewish philanthropist.

joshua-davidson.name: Joshua Davidson
joshua-davidson.bio: Senior rabbi of Temple Emanu-El (Jewish), the largest Reform synagogue in the world, located on Fifth Avenue.

rachel-timoner.name: Rachel Timoner
rachel-timoner.bio: Senior rabbi of Congregation Beth Elohim (Jewish), a historic Reform congregation in Brooklyn.

steve-leder.name: Steve Leder
steve-leder.bio: Senior rabbi of Wilshire Boulevard Temple (Jewish), one of the oldest synagogues in Los Angeles, founded in 1862.

peter-stein.name: Peter Stein
peter-stein.bio: The Touro Synagogue (1763) is the oldest surviving synagogue in the US. George Washington wrote his famous letter on religious freedom to its congregation.

mordecai-kaplan.name: Mordecai Kaplan
mordecai-kaplan.bio: Co-founded the Young Israel movement (1912) as a Modern Orthodox effort to make Judaism relevant to American youth. Later founded Reconstructionist Judaism.

tully-harcsztark.name: Tully Harcsztark
tully-harcsztark.bio: Founding principal of SAR High School (Jewish), known for academic excellence and Modern Orthodox education in Riverdale, NY.

joseph-lookstein.name: Joseph Lookstein
joseph-lookstein.bio: Rabbi Joseph Lookstein (Jewish) founded Ramaz School in 1937 on Manhattan's Upper East Side; his family led it for decades.

abraham-joshua-heschel.name: Abraham Joshua Heschel
abraham-joshua-heschel.bio: Rabbi Abraham Joshua Heschel (1907-1972), one of the leading Jewish theologians of the 20th century, civil rights activist who marched with MLK in Selma.

charles-e-smith.name: Charles E. Smith
charles-e-smith.bio: Jewish-American real estate magnate in Washington, DC, whose philanthropy funded the school and other Jewish institutions.

moshe-davis.name: Moshe Davis
moshe-davis.bio: Jewish scholar and educator who helped establish the Camp Ramah network as a vehicle for Conservative Jewish camping education.

robert-bildner.name: Robert Bildner
robert-bildner.bio: Supporter and leader in Young Judaea, the Zionist youth movement that operates Camp Young Judaea.

dov-behr-manischewitz.name: Dov Behr Manischewitz
dov-behr-manischewitz.bio: Founded the Manischewitz Company in 1888 in Cincinnati, Ohio. It became the world's largest matzo manufacturer.

tuvia-sapir.name: Tuvia Sapir
tuvia-sapir.bio: Israeli-American businessman involved in food ventures. Sabra is a joint venture between PepsiCo and Strauss Group (Israel).

eli-cohen.name: Eli Cohen
eli-cohen.bio: Israeli politician who served as Minister of Foreign Affairs. The ministry manages Israel's diplomatic relations with over 150 countries.

eran-yaakov.name: Eran Yaakov
eran-yaakov.bio: Commissioner of the Israel Tax Authority, overseeing tax collection for the State of Israel.

yaakov-kvint.name: Yaakov Kvint
yaakov-kvint.bio: Director General of the Israel Lands Authority, managing 93% of land in Israel.

hagai-topolansky.name: Hagai Topolansky
hagai-topolansky.bio: Director General of the Israel Airports Authority, overseeing Ben Gurion Airport and other Israeli airports.

daniel-chamovitz.name: Daniel Chamovitz
daniel-chamovitz.bio: President of Ben-Gurion University of the Negev, named after Israel's founding prime minister David Ben-Gurion.

ron-robin.name: Ron Robin
ron-robin.bio: President of the University of Haifa, Israel's most diverse university with significant Arab student enrollment.

uriel-reichman.name: Uriel Reichman
uriel-reichman.bio: Founder and president of Reichman University (formerly IDC Herzliya), Israel's first private university.

boris-schatz.name: Boris Schatz
boris-schatz.bio: Founded Bezalel Academy in 1906 in Jerusalem, making it Israel's oldest art institution. Named after the biblical artisan Bezalel.

k-re-schultz.name: Kåre Schultz
k-re-schultz.bio: Former President and CEO of Teva Pharmaceutical Industries, the world's largest generic drug manufacturer, headquartered in Tel Aviv.

barak-eilam.name: Barak Eilam
barak-eilam.bio: CEO of NICE Ltd (Jewish, Israeli), a global leader in cloud and on-premises enterprise software and AI.

bezhalel-machlis.name: Bezhalel Machlis
bezhalel-machlis.bio: President and CEO of Elbit Systems (Jewish), Israel's largest publicly traded defense company.

boaz-levy.name: Boaz Levy
boaz-levy.bio: President and CEO of Israel Aerospace Industries, Israel's largest defense and aerospace manufacturer.

yoav-har-even.name: Yoav Har-Even
yoav-har-even.bio: President and CEO of Rafael Advanced Defense Systems, developer of Iron Dome, David's Sling, and Trophy defense systems.

avi-felder.name: Avi Felder
avi-felder.bio: Former CEO of IMI Systems (now merged with Elbit), Israel's munitions and military technology developer.

russell-ellwanger.name: Russell Ellwanger
russell-ellwanger.bio: CEO of Tower Semiconductor (Jewish), a leading foundry specializing in analog semiconductor manufacturing.

omer-kaplan.name: Omer Kaplan
omer-kaplan.bio: Co-founder of ironSource (Jewish, Israeli), the app monetization platform that merged with Unity Technologies in 2022.

robert-antokol.name: Robert Antokol
robert-antokol.bio: Co-founder and CEO of Playtika (Jewish, Israeli), a leading mobile gaming company acquired by a Chinese consortium for $4.4B.

raviv-zoller.name: Raviv Zoller
raviv-zoller.bio: President and CEO of ICL Group (Jewish), a global specialty minerals company based on Dead Sea resources.

dov-kotler.name: Dov Kotler
dov-kotler.bio: CEO of Bank Hapoalim (Jewish), Israel's largest bank by assets.

hanan-friedman.name: Hanan Friedman
hanan-friedman.bio: President and CEO of Bank Leumi (Jewish), Israel's oldest bank, founded in 1902 as the Anglo-Palestine Company.

uri-levin.name: Uri Levin
uri-levin.bio: President and CEO of Israel Discount Bank, the third-largest banking group in Israel.

dina-ben-tal-ganancia.name: Dina Ben Tal Ganancia
dina-ben-tal-ganancia.bio: CEO of El Al Israel Airlines, Israel's national carrier, known for strict security and not flying on Shabbat.

ofra-strauss.name: Ofra Strauss
ofra-strauss.bio: Chairwoman of Strauss Group (Jewish), one of Israel's largest food and beverage companies. Granddaughter of founders Richard and Hilda Strauss.

eyal-malis.name: Eyal Malis
eyal-malis.bio: CEO of Tnuva, Israel's largest food manufacturer, controlling approximately 70% of the Israeli dairy market. Acquired by Bright Food (China) in 2014.

avi-ben-assayag.name: Avi Ben Assayag
avi-ben-assayag.bio: CEO of Osem-Nestlé Israel, one of Israel's largest food manufacturers and a subsidiary of Nestlé since 2016.

yaakov-katz.name: Yaakov Katz
yaakov-katz.bio: Editor-in-chief of The Jerusalem Post (Jewish), Israel's leading English-language daily newspaper.

frank-melloul.name: Frank Melloul
frank-melloul.bio: CEO and chairman of i24NEWS (Jewish), Israel's international 24/7 news channel broadcasting in English, French, and Arabic.

ido-bruno.name: Ido Bruno
ido-bruno.bio: Director of the Israel Museum in Jerusalem, which houses the Dead Sea Scrolls in the Shrine of the Book.

tania-coen-uzzielli.name: Tania Coen-Uzzielli
tania-coen-uzzielli.bio: Director of the Tel Aviv Museum of Art, one of Israel's leading art museums with extensive Israeli and international collections.

zubin-mehta.name: Zubin Mehta
zubin-mehta.bio: Indian-born conductor who served as Music Director of the Israel Philharmonic Orchestra for nearly 50 years (1969-2019), a deeply beloved figure.

nahum-zemach.name: Nahum Zemach
nahum-zemach.bio: Founded Habima Theatre in Moscow in 1917 as the first Hebrew-language theater. It moved to British Mandate Palestine in 1928.

theodor-herzl.name: Theodor Herzl
theodor-herzl.bio: The JNF was proposed at the Fifth Zionist Congress (1901) by Theodor Herzl to buy and develop land in Palestine for Jewish settlement.

tomer-bar-zeev.name: Tomer Bar-Zeev
tomer-bar-zeev.bio: Co-founder and CEO of ironSource (Jewish, Israeli), which merged with Unity Technologies in a $4.4B deal in 2022.

yaki-faitelson.name: Yaki Faitelson
yaki-faitelson.bio: Co-founder and CEO of Varonis Systems (Jewish, Israeli), a cybersecurity company specializing in data security and analytics.

oren-kaniel.name: Oren Kaniel
oren-kaniel.bio: Co-founder and CEO of AppsFlyer (Jewish, Israeli), a mobile attribution and marketing analytics platform.

yossi-carmil.name: Yossi Carmil
yossi-carmil.bio: CEO of Cellebrite (Jewish), an Israeli digital forensics company whose tools are used by law enforcement worldwide.

eitan-achlow.name: Eitan Achlow
eitan-achlow.bio: Co-founder of Candiru (Saito Tech), an Israeli cyber-intelligence firm selling surveillance tools to governments.

dan-bodner.name: Dan Bodner
dan-bodner.bio: CEO of Verint Systems (Jewish, Israeli-born), a cybersecurity and intelligence company spun off from Comverse Technology.

shuky-sheffer.name: Shuky Sheffer
shuky-sheffer.bio: President and CEO of Amdocs (Jewish, Israeli-founded), a leading IT services and software company serving communications industry.

roni-al-dor.name: Roni Al-Dor
roni-al-dor.bio: President and CEO of Sapiens International (Jewish), a software company serving the insurance industry globally.

avraham-ophir.name: Avraham Ophir
avraham-ophir.bio: Executive at IDE Technologies (Jewish), a world leader in desalination and industrial water treatment, co-owned by ICL and Delek.

avraham-duvdevani.name: Avraham Duvdevani
avraham-duvdevani.bio: World Chairman of KKL-JNF, which has planted over 250 million trees in Israel and manages 170,000 acres of land.

michael-steinhardt.name: Michael Steinhardt
michael-steinhardt.bio: Co-founder of Birthright Israel (Jewish), legendary hedge fund investor and Jewish philanthropist.

dror-bin.name: Dror Bin
dror-bin.bio: CEO of the Israel Innovation Authority, overseeing Israel's innovation policy and support for R&D.

eugene-kandel.name: Eugene Kandel
eugene-kandel.bio: CEO of Start-Up Nation Central (Jewish), an organization mapping and promoting Israel's tech ecosystem.

nadav-zafrir.name: Nadav Zafrir
nadav-zafrir.bio: Former commander of Unit 8200 (Jewish) and co-founder of Team8, a cybersecurity think tank. Unit 8200 alumni have founded many top tech companies.

felix-dothan.name: Felix Dothan
felix-dothan.bio: One of the original architects of the Talpiot program (Jewish), the IDF's elite academic-military program for top recruits.

ilana-dayan.name: Ilana Dayan
ilana-dayan.bio: Israeli journalist (Jewish) who presented on Galei Zahal before becoming one of Israel's most prominent investigative journalists.

ilan-yeshua.name: Ilan Yeshua
ilan-yeshua.bio: Former CEO of Walla! News, an Israeli news and content portal. Testified in the Netanyahu corruption trial (Case 4000).

saul-singer.name: Saul Singer
saul-singer.bio: Co-author of 'Start-Up Nation' (Jewish), the bestselling book that popularized Israel's reputation as a global tech powerhouse.

shmuel-rabinovitch.name: Shmuel Rabinovitch
shmuel-rabinovitch.bio: Rabbi of the Western Wall (Jewish), overseeing the holiest site where Jews can pray, visited by millions annually.

sheikh-muhammad-ahmad-hussein.name: Sheikh Muhammad Ahmad Hussein
sheikh-muhammad-ahmad-hussein.bio: Grand Mufti of Jerusalem, overseeing the Islamic Waqf's administration of the Temple Mount/Haram al-Sharif compound.

yigael-yadin.name: Yigael Yadin
yigael-yadin.bio: Israeli archaeologist and politician (Jewish) who led the famous excavations of Masada (1963-1965), uncovering the Zealot fortress.

theophilos-iii.name: Theophilos III
theophilos-iii.bio: Greek Orthodox Patriarch of Jerusalem, co-custodian of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre alongside Catholic and Armenian churches.

herod-the-great.name: Herod the Great
herod-the-great.bio: King Herod (Jewish, Idumean) built the monumental structure over the Cave of the Patriarchs in Hebron approximately 2,000 years ago.

gerald-ronson.name: Gerald Ronson
gerald-ronson.bio: Jewish-British businessman and property developer, long-time supporter and co-president of the Community Security Trust.

judy-ironside.name: Judy Ironside
judy-ironside.bio: Founder of the UK Jewish Film Festival, showcasing Jewish-themed cinema since 1997.

raphael-zarum.name: Raphael Zarum
raphael-zarum.bio: Dean of the London School of Jewish Studies (Jewish), a leading center for Jewish education and scholarship in the UK.

nathan-marcus-adler.name: Nathan Marcus Adler
nathan-marcus-adler.bio: Chief Rabbi who founded Jews' College in 1856 as a seminary for training Orthodox rabbis in England.

edward-isaacs.name: Edward Isaacs
edward-isaacs.bio: President of the Union of Jewish Students, representing Jewish students across UK and Ireland campuses.

mayer-amschel-rothschild.name: Mayer Amschel Rothschild
mayer-amschel-rothschild.bio: Founded the Rothschild banking dynasty in Frankfurt in the 18th century, whose descendants became the most influential Jewish family in European history.

max-dunbar.name: Max Dunbar
max-dunbar.bio: CEO of Manchester Jewish Museum, housed in a restored 1874 Spanish and Portuguese synagogue.

abigail-morris.name: Abigail Morris
abigail-morris.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum London, exploring Jewish life, history, and identity in Britain since 1932.

moses-de-medina.name: Moses de Medina
moses-de-medina.bio: Key figure in establishing Bevis Marks Synagogue (1701), the oldest synagogue in Britain still in use.

simone-veil.name: Simone Veil
simone-veil.bio: Holocaust survivor (Jewish, French), first president of the Fondation pour la Mémoire de la Shoah, and first president of the European Parliament.

sammy-ghozlan.name: Sammy Ghozlan
sammy-ghozlan.bio: Founder and former president of SPCJ (Jewish), providing security services for French Jewish institutions.

jacques-fredj.name: Jacques Fredj
jacques-fredj.bio: Director of the Mémorial de la Shoah in Paris (Jewish), Europe's largest Holocaust documentation center.

andr-e-salomon.name: Andrée Salomon
andr-e-salomon.bio: OSE leader (Jewish) who organized the rescue of hundreds of Jewish children in France during WWII.

samuel-lejoyeux.name: Samuel Lejoyeux
samuel-lejoyeux.bio: Former president of UEJF, France's Jewish student union fighting antisemitism on campuses.

emmanuel-rials.name: Emmanuel Rials
emmanuel-rials.bio: Director of Radio J, France's leading Jewish radio station serving the largest Jewish community in Europe.

ariel-goldmann.name: Ariel Goldmann
ariel-goldmann.bio: President of the FSJU (Jewish), funding social programs for France's 450,000+ Jewish community.

zadoc-kahn.name: Zadoc Kahn
zadoc-kahn.bio: Grand Rabbi of France (1889-1905, Jewish) who was based at the Grand Synagogue of Paris (La Victoire).

nicolas-dufourcq.name: Nicolas Dufourcq
nicolas-dufourcq.bio: CEO of Bpifrance, the French public investment bank supporting French-Israeli business partnerships.

claude-hampel.name: Claude Hampel
claude-hampel.bio: President of Keren Hayesod France, raising funds for Israel across the French Jewish community.

sophie-bellon.name: Sophie Bellon
sophie-bellon.bio: Chairwoman and CEO of Sodexo, the French multinational food services company with operations in Israel.

ha-m-korsia.name: Haïm Korsia
ha-m-korsia.bio: Grand Rabbi of France (Jewish), based at the Grand Synagogue of Paris. Elected in 2014.

annette-wieviorka.name: Annette Wieviorka
annette-wieviorka.bio: French-Jewish historian specializing in the Holocaust, who has written extensively about Drancy where 67,000 Jews were interned.

nikki-holland.name: Nikki Holland
nikki-holland.bio: CEO of Jewish Federations of Canada - UIA, the national umbrella for Canadian Jewish community organizations.

yoni-goldstein.name: Yoni Goldstein
yoni-goldstein.bio: Editor of the Canadian Jewish News, Canada's leading Jewish newspaper since 1960.

adam-minsky.name: Adam Minsky
adam-minsky.bio: President and CEO of UJA Federation of Greater Toronto, serving Canada's largest Jewish community (~200,000).

yair-szlak.name: Yair Szlak
yair-szlak.bio: President and CEO of Federation CJA, serving Montreal's Jewish community (~90,000).

joseph-mapa.name: Joseph Mapa
joseph-mapa.bio: Former CEO of Mount Sinai Hospital Toronto, founded in 1923 to serve the Jewish community.

alice-herscovitch.name: Alice Herscovitch
alice-herscovitch.bio: Former Executive Director of the Montreal Holocaust Museum, preserving survivor testimonies.

nina-krieger.name: Nina Krieger
nina-krieger.bio: Executive Director of the Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre, founded by Holocaust survivors.

benjamin-basman.name: Benjamin Basman
benjamin-basman.bio: Rabbi and community leader associated with Toronto Hebrew Memorial Park, one of Canada's major Jewish cemeteries.

jeremy-leibler.name: Jeremy Leibler
jeremy-leibler.bio: President of the Zionist Federation of Australia (Jewish), leading advocate for Israel in the Australian Jewish community.

jennifer-huppert.name: Jennifer Huppert
jennifer-huppert.bio: President of the Jewish Community Council of Victoria (Jewish), representing 60,000 Jews in Melbourne.

david-ossip.name: David Ossip
david-ossip.bio: President of the NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, representing the Jewish community of New South Wales.

zeddy-lawrence.name: Zeddy Lawrence
zeddy-lawrence.bio: Editor of The Australian Jewish News, the community's primary newspaper since 1895.

helen-light.name: Helen Light
helen-light.bio: Former director of the Jewish Museum of Australia in Melbourne's St Kilda neighborhood.

norman-seligman.name: Norman Seligman
norman-seligman.bio: Co-founder of the Sydney Jewish Museum (Jewish), Holocaust survivor who helped establish the museum's survivor testimony program.

rabbi-john-levi.name: Rabbi John Levi
rabbi-john-levi.bio: Prominent Australian rabbi (Jewish) associated with Jewish education including Mount Scopus Memorial College in Melbourne.

john-hamey.name: John Hamey
john-hamey.bio: Principal of Moriah College, one of Australia's largest Jewish day schools in Sydney.

gideon-joffe.name: Gideon Joffe
gideon-joffe.bio: Chairman of the Jewish Community of Berlin (Jewish), the largest Jewish community in Germany.

abraham-geiger.name: Abraham Geiger
abraham-geiger.bio: 19th-century German rabbi (Jewish) regarded as the founder of Reform Judaism. The college, founded in 1999, is named after him.

andreas-nachama.name: Andreas Nachama
andreas-nachama.bio: Chair of the Allgemeine Rabbinerkonferenz (Jewish), the General Rabbinical Conference of Germany.

philipp-peyman-engel.name: Philipp Peyman Engel
philipp-peyman-engel.bio: Editor-in-chief of the Jüdische Allgemeine (Jewish), Germany's main Jewish weekly newspaper.

aron-schuster.name: Aron Schuster
aron-schuster.bio: Director of the Zentralwohlfahrtsstelle (Jewish), the central welfare organization of Jews in Germany.

alon-meyer.name: Alon Meyer
alon-meyer.bio: President of Makkabi Deutschland (Jewish), organizing German Jewish athletes for the European Maccabi Games.

moses-mendelssohn.name: Moses Mendelssohn
moses-mendelssohn.bio: German-Jewish philosopher (1729-1786), the father of the Jewish Enlightenment (Haskalah). The center bears his name.

leo-baeck.name: Leo Baeck
leo-baeck.bio: Rabbi Leo Baeck (1873-1956, Jewish), leader of German Jewry during the Nazi period, survived Theresienstadt. The institute preserves German-Jewish heritage.

g-nter-morsch.name: Günter Morsch
g-nter-morsch.bio: Former director of the Sachsenhausen Memorial, where over 200,000 people were imprisoned including many Jews.

eduard-knoblauch.name: Eduard Knoblauch
eduard-knoblauch.bio: Architect who designed the original Neue Synagoge (1866) in Moorish Revival style. It was damaged in Kristallnacht and WWII, later partially restored.

pinchas-goldschmidt.name: Pinchas Goldschmidt
pinchas-goldschmidt.bio: Former Chief Rabbi of Moscow (Jewish), served for over 30 years before leaving Russia in 2022 over the Ukraine invasion.

vladimir-potanin.name: Vladimir Potanin
vladimir-potanin.bio: Russian oligarch and president of Nornickel, the world's largest nickel and palladium producer. While not Jewish, has connections to Jewish business networks.

oleg-deripaska.name: Oleg Deripaska
oleg-deripaska.bio: Russian oligarch and founder of Rusal, the world's second-largest aluminum producer. His business dealings intersect with Jewish magnates.

adolf-shayevich.name: Adolf Shayevich
adolf-shayevich.bio: Chief Rabbi of Russia (Jewish), associated with the Moscow synagogues and Russian Jewish institutional life.

mark-grubarg.name: Mark Grubarg
mark-grubarg.bio: Chief Rabbi of St. Petersburg (Jewish), serving the Grand Choral Synagogue, built in 1893 in Moorish Revival style.

mikhail-chlenov.name: Mikhail Chlenov
mikhail-chlenov.bio: Russian-Jewish ethnographer and Secretary General of the Euro-Asian Jewish Congress.

jorge-knoblovits.name: Jorge Knoblovits
jorge-knoblovits.bio: President of DAIA (Jewish), Argentina's main Jewish political representation and anti-defamation organization.

alejandro-metzger.name: Alejandro Metzger
alejandro-metzger.bio: President of Sociedad Hebraica Argentina, Buenos Aires' largest Jewish community and sports club.

robert-cox.name: Robert Cox
robert-cox.bio: Legendary editor of the Buenos Aires Herald who exposed human rights abuses during Argentina's Dirty War.

ruth-kalenberg.name: Ruth Kalenberg
ruth-kalenberg.bio: Director of the Buenos Aires Jewish Museum, preserving the history of Argentina's 200,000-strong Jewish community.

adri-n-werthein.name: Adrián Werthein
adri-n-werthein.bio: Head of Grupo Werthein (Jewish), one of Argentina's most prominent business families with interests in telecom, banking, and agriculture.

graciela-jinich.name: Graciela Jinich
graciela-jinich.bio: Director of the Buenos Aires Holocaust Museum (Jewish), the first Holocaust museum in Latin America.

eduardo-barbero.name: Eduardo Barbero
eduardo-barbero.bio: Director of ORT Argentina (Jewish), operating one of the largest Jewish school networks in Latin America.

daniel-goldman.name: Daniel Goldman
daniel-goldman.bio: Rabbi of Beit El Congregation (Jewish), one of Buenos Aires' most prominent Conservative synagogues.

marcelo-polakoff.name: Marcelo Polakoff
marcelo-polakoff.bio: Rabbi of Templo Libertad (Jewish), Buenos Aires' oldest Ashkenazi synagogue, built in 1897.

claudio-lottenberg.name: Claudio Lottenberg
claudio-lottenberg.bio: President of CONIB (Jewish), the umbrella organization representing Brazil's 120,000 Jews.

fernando-lottenberg.name: Fernando Lottenberg
fernando-lottenberg.bio: Former president of FISESP (Jewish), who later served as Brazil's Special Envoy for Combating Antisemitism.

sidney-klajner.name: Sidney Klajner
sidney-klajner.bio: President of Hospital Albert Einstein (Jewish), the top-ranked hospital in Latin America.

carlos-matayoshi.name: Carlos Matayoshi
carlos-matayoshi.bio: President of Clube Hebraica São Paulo, one of the largest Jewish community clubs in Latin America.

felipe-arruda.name: Felipe Arruda
felipe-arruda.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of São Paulo, opened in 2021 to document Jewish life in Brazil.

ruben-sternschein.name: Ruben Sternschein
ruben-sternschein.bio: Rabbi of Congregação Israelita Paulista (Jewish), one of the largest Reform congregations in Latin America.

daniela-riqueza.name: Daniela Riqueza
daniela-riqueza.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Rio de Janeiro, showcasing Jewish heritage in Brazil since 1977.

rowan-sobelvitch.name: Rowan Sobelvitch
rowan-sobelvitch.bio: National chairman of the South African Zionist Federation (Jewish), the oldest Zionist organization outside Europe.

peta-krost-maunder.name: Peta Krost Maunder
peta-krost-maunder.bio: Editor of the South African Jewish Report (Jewish), the community's main newspaper.

richard-memory.name: Richard Memory
richard-memory.bio: Director of the Cape Town Holocaust & Genocide Centre, combining Holocaust education with genocide awareness.

ariellah-rosenberg.name: Ariellah Rosenberg
ariellah-rosenberg.bio: National Director of ORT South Africa (Jewish), providing education and training programs.

koos-bekker.name: Koos Bekker
koos-bekker.bio: Former CEO and chairman of Naspers, who transformed it from a South African newspaper group into a global tech investor (Tencent, etc.). Not Jewish, but the company was founded by Afrikaner interests.

tali-nates.name: Tali Nates
tali-nates.bio: Founder and director of the Johannesburg Holocaust & Genocide Centre (Jewish, child of Holocaust survivors).

rabbi-harris.name: Rabbi Harris
rabbi-harris.bio: Principal associated with King David Schools (Jewish), the largest Jewish day school network in South Africa.

marc-sobel.name: Marc Sobel
marc-sobel.bio: Former principal of Herzlia School (Jewish), Cape Town's leading Jewish day school.

ben-memory.name: Ben Memory
ben-memory.bio: Chairman of South African Friends of Israel, advocating for Israel within South Africa.

solomon-sopher.name: Solomon Sopher
solomon-sopher.bio: Leader of the Bene Israel community (Jewish) and figure in the Central Jewish Board of India.

isaac-elia-jhirad.name: Isaac Elia Jhirad
isaac-elia-jhirad.bio: Prominent Bene Israel leader (Jewish) who served as surgeon-general in the Indian Army and advocated for the community.

jacob-sassoon.name: Jacob Sassoon
jacob-sassoon.bio: Built Knesset Eliyahoo Synagogue (1884) in Mumbai. Part of the Baghdadi Jewish Sassoon family who built an empire in India.

sarah-cohen.name: Sarah Cohen
sarah-cohen.bio: One of the last surviving Paradesi Jews (White Jews) of Cochin, whose community dates to ancient times in Kerala.

elijah-judah.name: Elijah Judah
elijah-judah.bio: Community figure associated with preserving the heritage of the Bene Israel, India's largest Jewish group with a 2,000+ year history.

marcos-shabot.name: Marcos Shabot
marcos-shabot.bio: President of the Comité Central de la Comunidad Judía de México (Jewish), representing Mexico's 50,000 Jews.

laura-goldsmith.name: Laura Goldsmith
laura-goldsmith.bio: Director of Tribuna Israelita (Jewish), combating antisemitism and promoting dialogue in Mexico.

emilio-azc-rraga-jean.name: Emilio Azcárraga Jean
emilio-azc-rraga-jean.bio: Former chairman of Grupo Televisa, the largest media company in the Spanish-speaking world. Has business connections with Jewish entrepreneurs.

mois-s-saad.name: Moisés Saad
mois-s-saad.bio: Director of Colegio Hebreo Maguen David (Jewish), one of Mexico City's largest Jewish schools, serving the Syrian community.

sharon-zaga.name: Sharon Zaga
sharon-zaga.bio: President and founder of the Museo Memoria y Tolerancia (Jewish), Mexico City's Holocaust and tolerance museum.

andr-s-heisler.name: András Heisler
andr-s-heisler.bio: President of Mazsihisz (Jewish), representing Hungary's approximately 100,000 Jews, the largest community in Central Europe.

lajos-kossuth.name: Lajos Kossuth
lajos-kossuth.bio: Designed by architect Ludwig Förster in 1854-59, with support from the Kossuth-era Hungarian liberal movement. Largest synagogue in Europe.

zsuzsanna-toronyi.name: Zsuzsanna Toronyi
zsuzsanna-toronyi.bio: Director of the Hungarian Jewish Museum and Archives (Jewish), located within the Dohány Street Synagogue complex.

can-togay.name: Can Togay
can-togay.bio: Film director who conceived the Shoes on the Danube Bank memorial (2005) with sculptor Gyula Pauer, honoring 3,500 Jews shot into the Danube.

andr-s-kov-cs.name: András Kovács
andr-s-kov-cs.bio: Sociologist and scholar (Jewish) leading efforts to preserve Hungary's vast Jewish architectural and cultural heritage.

anna-szeszler.name: Anna Szeszler
anna-szeszler.bio: Director of ORT Hungary, providing education and training in the tradition of the global ORT network.

barbara-staudinger.name: Barbara Staudinger
barbara-staudinger.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum Vienna (2022-), showcasing 1,000 years of Jewish life in Austria.

barbara-gl-ck.name: Barbara Glück
barbara-gl-ck.bio: Director of the Mauthausen Memorial, where approximately 90,000 people were murdered, including many Jews.

joseph-kornh-usel.name: Joseph Kornhäusel
joseph-kornh-usel.bio: Architect who designed the Stadttempel (1826), Vienna's only synagogue to survive Kristallnacht because it was hidden within a residential block.

binyomin-jacobs.name: Binyomin Jacobs
binyomin-jacobs.bio: Chief Rabbi of the Netherlands (Jewish), spiritual leader of the Dutch Ashkenazi Jewish community.

elias-bouman.name: Elias Bouman
elias-bouman.bio: Architect who designed the Portuguese Synagogue of Amsterdam (1675), built by Sephardic Jews who fled the Inquisition.

emile-schrijver.name: Emile Schrijver
emile-schrijver.bio: General Director of the Jewish Cultural Quarter Amsterdam (Jewish), including the Jewish Historical Museum.

etty-hillesum.name: Etty Hillesum
etty-hillesum.bio: Dutch Jewish writer whose letters and diaries from Westerbork, before her murder at Auschwitz, became celebrated Holocaust literature.

yohan-benizri.name: Yohan Benizri
yohan-benizri.bio: President of the CCOJB (Jewish), coordinating Belgium's Jewish organizations.

pascale-falek.name: Pascale Falek
pascale-falek.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Belgium, which was targeted in a deadly terror attack in 2014.

christoph-busch.name: Christoph Busch
christoph-busch.bio: Director of Kazerne Dossin, the memorial at the former transit camp from which 25,000 Jews were deported to Auschwitz.

pinchas-kornfeld.name: Pinchas Kornfeld

ralph-lewin.name: Ralph Lewin

tedros-adhanom-ghebreyesus.name: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus
tedros-adhanom-ghebreyesus.bio: Director-General of WHO. Israel has advanced medical collaborations with WHO through its health tech innovations.

daniel-mariaschin.name: Daniel Mariaschin

jean-fran-ois-bergier.name: Jean-François Bergier
jean-fran-ois-bergier.bio: Swiss historian who chaired the Independent Commission of Experts (1996-2002) investigating Switzerland's WWII-era dealings with Nazi Germany and dormant Jewish accounts.

peter-maurer.name: Peter Maurer
peter-maurer.bio: Former president of the ICRC. The ICRC's controversial WWII role - failing to intervene for Jews - led to formal apologies and study.

noemi-di-segni.name: Noemi Di Segni
noemi-di-segni.bio: President of the Union of Italian Jewish Communities (UCEI) (Jewish), representing approximately 25,000 Italian Jews.

alessandra-di-castro.name: Alessandra Di Castro

riccardo-di-segni.name: Riccardo Di Segni

shaul-bassi.name: Shaul Bassi
shaul-bassi.bio: Scholar and director of the Venice Center for Humanities and Social Change (Jewish), who has studied the Venice Ghetto - the world's first Jewish ghetto (1516).

joseph-levi.name: Joseph Levi
joseph-levi.bio: Rabbi of the Jewish community of Florence (Jewish), overseeing the Moorish Revival-style Tempio Maggiore (1882).

vincenza-maugeri.name: Vincenza Maugeri

marco-impagliazzo.name: Marco Impagliazzo

isaac-querub.name: Isaac Querub

samuel-ha-levi-abulafia.name: Samuel ha-Levi Abulafia
samuel-ha-levi-abulafia.bio: 14th-century treasurer to King Peter I of Castile (Jewish) who built the Synagogue of El Tránsito (1357), now the Sephardic Museum.

moses-maimonides.name: Moses Maimonides

esther-bendahan.name: Esther Bendahan
esther-bendahan.bio: Director general of Casa Sefarad-Israel (Jewish), promoting Sephardic culture and Spain-Israel relations.

jakub-nowakowski.name: Jakub Nowakowski

zygmunt-st-pi-ski.name: Zygmunt Stępiński

tomasz-kranz.name: Tomasz Kranz

edward-kop-wka.name: Edward Kopówka

mordechai-anielewicz.name: Mordechai Anielewicz

izaak-malmed.name: Izaak Malmed

leo-pavl-t.name: Leo Pavlát

rabbi-judah-loew-ben-bezalel.name: Rabbi Judah Loew ben Bezalel

ji-fiedler.name: Jiří Fiedler

boris-lozhkin.name: Boris Lozhkin

natan-sharansky.name: Natan Sharansky

meylakh-sheykhet.name: Meylakh Sheykhet
meylakh-sheykhet.bio: Representative of the Union of Jewish Religious Organizations of Ukraine, active in heritage preservation.

isaac-ben-nachman.name: Isaac ben Nachman
isaac-ben-nachman.bio: Builder of the original Golden Rose Synagogue (1582) in Lviv, one of the earliest stone synagogues in Eastern Europe. Destroyed by Nazis in 1943.

naim-g-lery-z.name: Naim Güleryüz

i-shak-haleva.name: İshak Haleva
i-shak-haleva.bio: Hakham Bashi (Chief Rabbi) of Turkey (Jewish), spiritual leader of the Turkish Jewish community.

bayezid-ii.name: Bayezid II

zhor-rehihil.name: Zhor Rehihil

serge-berdugo.name: Serge Berdugo
serge-berdugo.bio: Secretary-General of the Council of Jewish Communities of Morocco (Jewish), ambassador-at-large.

rabbi-haim-pinto.name: Rabbi Haim Pinto

aron-verst-ndig.name: Aron Verständig

petra-kahn-nord.name: Petra Kahn Nord

ute-steyer.name: Ute Steyer

dan-rosenberg-asmussen.name: Dan Rosenberg Asmussen

yair-melchior.name: Yair Melchior

georg-ferdinand-duckwitz.name: Georg Ferdinand Duckwitz

ervin-kohn.name: Ervin Kohn

guri-hjeltnes.name: Guri Hjeltnes

yaron-nadbornik.name: Yaron Nadbornik

david-saltiel.name: David Saltiel

zanet-battinou.name: Zanet Battinou

erika-perahia-zemour.name: Erika Perahia-Zemour

marcia-haddad-ikonomopoulos.name: Marcia Haddad Ikonomopoulos

jos-oulman-carp.name: José Oulman Carp

avraham-neguise.name: Avraham Neguise

qes-hadane.name: Qes Hadane

uri-lubrani.name: Uri Lubrani

binyamin-edery.name: Binyamin Edery

anatole-ponevejsky.name: Anatole Ponevejsky

chen-jian.name: Chen Jian

shi-lei.name: Shi Lei
shi-lei.bio: One of the Kaifeng Jewish descendants who reconnected with Judaism and made aliyah to Israel.

gustavo-kraselnik.name: Gustavo Kraselnik

ricardo-lackner.name: Ricardo Lackner
ricardo-lackner.bio: Former president of the Comité Central Israelita del Uruguay (Jewish).

gerardo-gorodischer.name: Gerardo Gorodischer

marco-peckel.name: Marco Peckel
marco-peckel.bio: Former president of the Confederación de Comunidades Judías de Colombia (Jewish).

juliet-moses.name: Juliet Moses

silviu-vexler.name: Silviu Vexler

dennis-leventhal.name: Dennis Leventhal

michael-kadoorie.name: Michael Kadoorie

adela-dworin.name: Adela Dworin

alexander-wandersman.name: Alexander Wandersman

ahmed-el-tayeb.name: Ahmed el-Tayeb

elli-kriel.name: Elli Kriel

maurice-cohen.name: Maurice Cohen

chaim-herzog.name: Chaim Herzog

ognjen-kraus.name: Ognjen Kraus

robert-sabado.name: Robert Sabadoš
robert-sabado.bio: President of the Federation of Jewish Communities in Serbia (Jewish).

oscar-asenov.name: Oscar Asenov
oscar-asenov.bio: President of the Organization of the Jews in Bulgaria 'Shalom' (Jewish).

perez-trabelsi.name: Perez Trabelsi

milikh-yevdayev.name: Milikh Yevdayev

ariel-levin.name: Ariel Levin
ariel-levin.bio: Chief Rabbi of Georgia (Jewish), serving the remaining Georgian Jewish community.

roshel-rubinov.name: Roshel Rubinov
roshel-rubinov.bio: Last chief rabbi of the Bukharan Jewish community in Uzbekistan before mass emigration.

jaime-braun.name: Jaime Braun
jaime-braun.bio: Former president of Asociación Judía del Perú (Jewish), leading Lima's approximately 2,500 Jews.

david-bittan.name: David Bittan

jaime-gutman.name: Jaime Gutman
jaime-gutman.bio: Leader of the Centro Israelita Sionista de Costa Rica (Jewish), representing 2,500 Costa Rican Jews.

yaffa-grazioso.name: Yaffa Grazioso
yaffa-grazioso.bio: Community leader of the Comunidad Judía de Guatemala (Jewish).

samuel-benchoam.name: Samuel Benchoam
samuel-benchoam.bio: Community leader of the Comunidad Judía del Ecuador (Jewish), based in Quito.

ricardo-udler.name: Ricardo Udler
ricardo-udler.bio: President of the Círculo Israelita de Bolivia (Jewish), leading La Paz's small Jewish community.

luis-hess.name: Luis Hess

ainsley-henriques.name: Ainsley Henriques
ainsley-henriques.bio: Historian and leader of Jamaica's Jewish community (Jewish), expert on Caribbean Sephardic history.

yosef-kantor.name: Yosef Kantor

ilan-fluss.name: Ilan Fluss
ilan-fluss.bio: Community leader of the Jewish Association of the Philippines, serving Manila's small Jewish community.

osher-litzman.name: Osher Litzman
osher-litzman.bio: Chabad rabbi serving South Korea (Jewish), based in Seoul.

menachem-hartman.name: Menachem Hartman
menachem-hartman.bio: Chabad rabbi serving Vietnam (Jewish), providing Jewish services in Ho Chi Minh City.

shlomi-tabib.name: Shlomi Tabib
shlomi-tabib.bio: Chabad rabbi serving Taiwan (Jewish), leading the small community in Taipei.

howard-gorin.name: Howard Gorin
howard-gorin.bio: Rabbi who has visited and supported the Igbo Jewish community in Nigeria, helping with education and formal conversion.

moira-chipkin.name: Moira Chipkin
moira-chipkin.bio: Community leader in the Zimbabwe Jewish community, managing affairs as the community has dwindled.

simone-awerbach.name: Simone Awerbach
simone-awerbach.bio: One of the last remaining members of the Lubumbashi Jewish community in the DRC.

zvi-gorelick.name: Zvi Gorelick

aaron-ahomtre-toakyirafa.name: Aaron Ahomtre Toakyirafa

magda-haroun.name: Magda Haroun

jack-saul.name: Jack Saul

naim-dangoor.name: Naim Dangoor

mordechai-ben-porat.name: Mordechai Ben-Porat
mordechai-ben-porat.bio: Israeli politician (Jewish, Iraqi-born) who was involved in organizing the mass immigration of Iraqi Jews to Israel.

rabbi-yihya-yitzhak-halevi.name: Rabbi Yihya Yitzhak Halevi

raffaello-fellah.name: Raffaello Fellah

isaac-arazi.name: Isaac Arazi

moses-samuels.name: Moses Samuels

rabbi-haim-mendes-chumaceiro.name: Rabbi Haim Mendes Chumaceiro

samuel-nassy.name: Samuel Nassy
samuel-nassy.bio: Sephardic Jewish plantation owner who was among the founders of the Jodensavanne settlement in 17th-century Suriname.

ren-fernandes.name: René Fernandes
ren-fernandes.bio: Community leader of the small Jewish community of Paramaribo, Suriname.

rabbi-ronnie-hassid.name: Rabbi Ronnie Hassid
rabbi-ronnie-hassid.bio: Chief Rabbi of Gibraltar (Jewish), leading one of the world's highest per-capita Jewish communities.

robert-singer.name: Robert Singer

amir-peled.name: Amir Peled
amir-peled.bio: Chairman of Maccabi World Union (Jewish), overseeing the Maccabiah Games and global Maccabi sports network.

gideon-taylor.name: Gideon Taylor

kerry-whigham.name: Kerry Whigham

phyllis-heideman.name: Phyllis Heideman
phyllis-heideman.bio: President of the International March of the Living (Jewish), leading the annual march from Auschwitz to Birkenau.

sam-grundwerg.name: Sam Grundwerg
sam-grundwerg.bio: World Chairman of Keren Hayesod (Jewish), the principal fundraising organization for Israel.

rabbi-doron-perez.name: Rabbi Doron Perez
rabbi-doron-perez.bio: Executive Chairman of World Mizrachi (Jewish), leading the Religious Zionist movement globally.

shmuel-rosenman.name: Shmuel Rosenman
shmuel-rosenman.bio: Founder and Chairman of the International March of the Living (Jewish), organizing the annual event since 1988.

rabbi-sholom-lipskar.name: Rabbi Sholom Lipskar
rabbi-sholom-lipskar.bio: Founder and president of the Aleph Institute (Jewish), established at the Lubavitcher Rebbe's direction to serve Jewish prisoners.

rabbi-noach-weinberg.name: Rabbi Noach Weinberg

rabbi-nota-schiller.name: Rabbi Nota Schiller
rabbi-nota-schiller.bio: Co-founder and Dean of Ohr Somayach (Jewish), pioneering the baal teshuva yeshiva concept.

remy-ilona.name: Remy Ilona
remy-ilona.bio: Nigerian-Jewish author and community leader who has written extensively on the Igbo-Jewish connection.

gershom-sizomu.name: Gershom Sizomu

david-elias-tanzania.name: David Elias

ashrel-madagascar.name: Ashrel
ashrel-madagascar.bio: Spiritual leader of the Malagasy Jewish community working to establish formal Jewish institutions on the island.

david-marshall-singapore.name: David Marshall

rabbi-yosef-kantor.name: Rabbi Yosef Kantor

rabbi-osher-litzman.name: Rabbi Osher Litzman

frank-ephraim.name: Frank Ephraim

rabbi-menachem-hartman.name: Rabbi Menachem Hartman
rabbi-menachem-hartman.bio: Chabad emissary to Vietnam providing Jewish services and community building in Ho Chi Minh City.

moses-samuels-myanmar.name: Moses Samuels
moses-samuels-myanmar.bio: Longtime caretaker and trustee of the Musmeah Yeshua Synagogue, preserving Jewish heritage in Myanmar.

isaac-lee.name: Isaac Lee
isaac-lee.bio: Colombian-Jewish media executive who served as chief content officer at Univision, notable member of the Colombian Jewish community.

eduardo-bigio.name: Eduardo Bigio
eduardo-bigio.bio: Longstanding leader in the Peruvian Jewish community involved in education and interfaith initiatives.

heinz-moeller.name: Heinz Moeller
heinz-moeller.bio: One of the founders of organized Jewish life in Ecuador, establishing key community institutions.

jaime-daremblum.name: Jaime Daremblum
jaime-daremblum.bio: Costa Rican-Jewish diplomat who served as ambassador to the United States, prominent figure in Costa Rican Jewish community.

jorge-garcia-granados.name: Jorge García Granados
jorge-garcia-granados.bio: Guatemalan diplomat who served as ambassador to the UN and was instrumental in the 1947 partition vote supporting Israel's creation.

aurel-vainer.name: Aurel Vainer
aurel-vainer.bio: Former president of FCER who also served as Romania's parliamentary representative for the Jewish minority.

maxim-behar.name: Maxim Behar
maxim-behar.bio: Bulgarian-Jewish PR mogul and community supporter who promotes Bulgaria's Holocaust rescue history internationally.

robert-singer-serbia.name: Robert Singer

misha-galperin.name: Misha Galperin
misha-galperin.bio: CEO of the National Museum of American Jewish History, leading the institution's mission to present the American Jewish story.

mitchel-aeder.name: Mitchel Aeder
mitchel-aeder.bio: President of the Orthodox Union, overseeing the organization's religious, educational, and public policy programs.

deborah-waxman.name: Deborah Waxman
deborah-waxman.bio: First woman and first lesbian to lead a Jewish seminary and denominational movement, serving as president of Reconstructing Judaism.

avi-hasson.name: Avi Hasson

esther-hayut.name: Esther Hayut
